title: KKR bumps up listed credit fund to $925m
text:
Investment giant KKR has increased the size of its proposed Australian listed credit fund to as much as $925 million.

KKR lodged supplementary regulatory filings for its proposed KKR Credit Income Fund on Thursday, which lifted the maximum raising size by $100 million to $925 million.

KKR also accelerated the raising timetable. The general and broker offer will open on Monday October 14 as planned and both will close two days later on October 16, rather than on October 31 and November 6 as previously flagged.

KKR was calling for bids into its new credit fund by October 16. Greg Newington

It comes as KKR has had brokers bidding into the offer and signalled there was more demand for stock than expected.

"As at the date of this Supplementary PDS, the Responsible Entity has received a high level of interest in the Offer," the document said.
description: Investment giant KKR has increased the size of its proposed Australian listed credit fund to as much as $925 million.
